input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line

Assigns a name to connect to the resource or specifies the device to be disconnected. There are two kinds of device names: disk drives (that is, D: through Z:) and printers (that is, LPT1: through LPT3:). Type an asterisk (*) instead of a specific device name to assign the next available device name.
Specifies the name of the server and the shared resource.
Specifies the name of theshared resource. If ShareName is omitted, a connection is attempted to the ipc$ share.
Specifies a different user name with which the connection is made. Format: [DottedDomainName\]UserName]
Specifies the password needed to access the shared resource.
Specify the domain of the user

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">net use ${device name} "\\${computer name}"\${share name}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${password}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${password}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('${Domainname}')!=0"> <xsl:if test="string-length('${username}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /user:${Domainname}\${username}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:if test="string-length('${username}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /user:${computer name}\${username}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /Y</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Connects a computer from a shared resource.
